doc.after: Various samurai clans struggled for power during the Kamakura and Ashikaga Shogunates Zen Buddhism spread among the samurai in the 13th century and helped to shape their standards of conduct particularly overcoming fear of death and killing but among the general populace Pure Land Buddhism was favored
